member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartLabelsBuilderBase`1.VisibleHandler(System.String)

member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the visible state of each label.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartLabelsBuilderBase`1.VisibleHandler(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the function used to set the labels visibility.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the visible state of each label.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                      .Name("Chart")
                      .Series(series => series
                          .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                          .Labels(labels => labels
                              .VisibleHandler(
                                   @<text>
                                   function(point) {
                                       return point.value > 5;
                                   }
                                   </text>
                               )
                          );
                      )
                      .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.GroupNameTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name template for auto-generated series when binding to grouped data.
member.param: The name template for auto-generated series when binding to grouped data.

example.code: <% Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource .Read(read => read.Action("_StockData", "Scatter_Charts")) .Group(group => group.Add(model => model.Symbol)) ) .Series(series => series.Bar(s => s.Sales) .Name("Sales") .GroupNameTemplate("#= series.name # for #= group.field # #= group.value #") ) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Color(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the function used to retrieve point color.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the color of each point.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                           .Color(
                               @<text>
                               function(point) {
                                   return point.value > 5 ? "red" : "green";
                               }
                               </text>
                           )
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>

<% Html.Kendo().Chart()

                               function(point) {
                                   return point.value > 5 ? "red" : "green";
                               }
                               </text>
                           )
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Aggregate(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the function used to retrieve point color.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the value of each aggregated point.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                           .Aggregate(
                               @<text>
                               function(values) {
                                   return values[0];
                               }
                               </text>
                           )
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Aggregate(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the function used to retrieve point color.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the value of each aggregated point.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                           .Aggregate("myAggregate")
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>
            <script>
            function myAggregate(values) {
                return values[0];
            }
            </script>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.ZIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the series stacking order relative to other series.
member.param:
The stacking order of series, relative to other series. The series with the highest Z-index will be placed on top.
Series with no Z-index will use the default stacking order based on series type. For example line series will be on top with bar and area following below.

example.code:

                       .Series(series => series

                               .Visible(true)
                           );
                        )
            %>

member.param: The error bars value.

member.param: The error bars difference from the point value.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.CategoricalErrorBarsBuilder.Value(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the error bars low and high value difference from the point value.
member.param: The error bar low value difference from point value.
The error bar high value difference from point value.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.CategoricalErrorBarsBuilder.Value(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets a handler function that returns the error bars value.
member.param: The handler code that returns the error bars value.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Chart(Model)
                        .Name("chart")
                        .Series(series => series
                            .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                            .ErrorBars(e => e.Value(o =>
                                   @"function(data) {
                                       var value = data.value,
                                           lowPercentage = value * 0.05,
                                           highPercentage = value * 0.1;                                    
                                       return [lowPercentage, highPercentage];
                                     }"
                             ))
                        )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartAxisBaseUnitStepsBuilder.Seconds(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The discrete BaseUnitStep values when BaseUnit is set to Seconds and BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto).
member.param: The discrete steps when BaseUnit is set to Seconds.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                .Name("chart")
                .Title("Units sold")
                .Series(series => {
                    series
                        .Column(new int[] { 20, 40, 45, 30, 50 });
                })
                .CategoryAxis(axis => axis
                    .Date()
                    .BaseUnit(ChartAxisBaseUnit.Fit)
                    .AutoBaseUnitSteps(steps => steps.Seconds(1, 2))
                )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartAxisCrosshairTooltipBuilder.Template(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the tooltip template
member.param: The tooltip template.
member.value:
A client-side template for the tooltip.
Available template variables:
value - the point value
member.remarks: The format string is ignored if a template is set.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                      .Name("Chart")
                      .Series(series => {
                           .series.Bar(new double[] { 15.7, 16.7, 20, 23.5, 26.6 }).Name("World");
                           .series.Bar(new double[] { 67.96, 68.93, 75, 74, 78 }).Name("United States");
                      })
                      .CategoryAxis(axis => axis
                           .Categories("2005", "2006", "2007", "2008", "2009")
                           .Crosshair(crosshair => crosshair
                                .Visible(true)
                                .Tooltip(tooltip => tooltip
                                     .Template("|<#= value #|>")
                                     .Visible(true)
                                )
                           )
                      )
                      .Render();
            %>

                      })
                      .CategoryAxis(axis => axis

                                .Visible(true)
                                .Tooltip(tooltip => tooltip

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBulletSeriesBuilder`1.Gap(System.Double)

Set distance between category clusters.
A value of 1 means that there is a total of 1 bullet width / vertical bullet height between categories. The distance is distributed evenly on each side. The default value is 1.5

member.param: Value of 1 means that the distance between bullets is equal to their width. The default value is 0

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBulletSeriesBuilder`1.ColorHandler(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the function used to retrieve point color.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the color of each point.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Bullet(s => s.Current, s => s.Target)
                           .ColorHandler(
                               @<text>
                               function(point) {
                                   return point.value > 5 ? "red" : "green";
                               }
                               </text>
                           )
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>

member.name: T:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1
member.summary: Defines the fluent interface for configuring bar series.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.#ctor(Kendo.Mvc.UI.IChartBoxPlotSeries)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The series.

member.summary: Sets the aggregate function for date series. This function is used when a category (an year, month, etc.) contains two or more points.
member.param: Lower aggregate name.
Q1 aggregate name.
Median aggregate name.
Q3 aggregate name.
Upper aggregate name.
Mean aggregate name.
Outliers aggregate name.

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Chart(Model) .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series.BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper) .Aggregate( ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.Max, ChartSeriesAggregate.First ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Gap(System.Double)
member.summary:
Set distance between category clusters.
A value of 1 means that there is a total of 1 point width between categories. The distance is distributed evenly on each side. The default value is 1

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Chart(Model) .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series.BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper).Gap(1.5)) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Spacing(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating the distance between points in the same category.
member.param: Value of 1 means that the distance between points in the same category. The default value is 0.3

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Chart(Model) .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series.BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper).Spacing(1)) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Border(System.Int32,System.String,Kendo.Mvc.UI.ChartDashType)
member.summary: Sets the points border
member.param: The points border width.
The points border color (CSS syntax).
The points border dash type.

example.code: <% Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series.BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper).Border("1", "#000", ChartDashType.Dot)) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Line(System.Int32,System.String,Kendo.Mvc.UI.ChartDashType)
member.summary: Configures the ohlc chart lines.
member.param: The lines width.
The lines color.
The lines dashType.

example.code: <% Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series .BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper) .Line(2, "red", ChartDashType.Dot) ) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Line(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the ohlc line width.
member.param: The lines width.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Line(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Configures the ohlc lines.
member.param: The lines width.
The lines color.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Line(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartLineBuilder})
member.summary: Configures the ohlc chart lines.
member.param: The configuration action.

example.code: <% Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series .BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper) .Line(line => line.Opacity(0.2)) ) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Outliers(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartMarkersBuilder})
member.summary: Configures the box plot chart outliers.
member.param: The configuration action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper)    
                           .Outliers(outliers => outliers
                               .Type(ChartMarkerShape.Triangle)
                           );
                       )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Outliers(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of box plot chart outliers.
member.param: The visibility. The default value is true.

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series .BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper) .Outliers(true); ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Extremum(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartMarkersBuilder})
member.summary: Configures the box plot chart extremum.
member.param: The configuration action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .BoxPlot(s => s.Lower, s => s.Q1, s => s.Median, s => s.Q3, s => s.Upper)    
                           .Extremum(extremum => extremum
                               .Type(ChartMarkerShape.Triangle)
                           );
                       )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBoxPlotSeriesBuilder`1.Extremum(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of box plot chart extremum.

member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of groups (categories) that the chart will attempt to produce when either BaseUnit is set to Fit or BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto). This option is ignored in all other cases.
member.param: the maximum number of groups (categories). The default value is 10.

member.summary: If set to false, the min and max dates will not be rounded off to the nearest baseUnit. This option is most useful in combination with explicit min and max dates. It will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the axis range should be rounded to the nearest base unit. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartBubbleSeriesBuilder`1.NegativeValues(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartNegativeValueSettingsBuilder})
member.summary: Configures the bubble chart behavior for negative values. By default negative values are not visible.
member.param: The configuration action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Bubble(s => s.x, s => s.y, s => s.size)
                           .NegativeValues(n => n
                               .Visible(true)
                           );
                        )
            %>

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                      .Name("Chart")
                      .Series(series => series
                           .Bubble(s => s.x, s => s.y, s => s.size)
                           .Border(1, "Red");
                      )
                      .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartMarkersBuilder.BackgroundHandler(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the function used to retrieve marker background.
member.param: The JavaScript function that will be executed to retrieve the background of each marker.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Series(series => series
                           .Line(s => s.Sales)
                           .Markers(m =>
                                m.BackgroundHandler(
                                    @<text>
                                    function(point) {
                                        return point.value > 5 ? "red" : "green";
                                    }
                                    </text>
                               )
                           )
                        )
                       .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramPdfSettingsBuilder`2.ProxyURL(System.String)
member.summary: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally. Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:The proxy should return the decoded file with set "Content-Disposition" header.
member.param: The value that configures the proxyurl.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramPdfSettingsBuilder`2.ProxyTarget(System.String)
member.summary: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe, the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>".
member.param: The value that configures the proxytarget.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.EditorPdfSettingsBuilder.ProxyURL(System.String)
member.summary: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally e.g. Internet Explorer 9 and Safari. PDF export is not supported in Internet Explorer 8 and below.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:The proxy should return the decoded file with the "Content-Disposition" header set to attachment; filename="<fileName.pdf>".
member.param: The value that configures the proxyurl.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.EditorPdfSettingsBuilder.ProxyTarget(System.String)
member.summary: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe, the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>".
member.param: The value that configures the proxytarget.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PivotConfiguratorBuilder.Sortable
member.summary: Enables grid column sorting.

example.code: <%:Html.Kendo().PivotConfigurator() .Name("pivotconfigurator") .Sortable() .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) %>

@(Html.Kendo().PivotConfigurator() .Name("pivotconfigurator") .Sortable() .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) )

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PivotConfiguratorBuilder.Sortable(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PivotConfiguratorSortSettingsBuilder})
member.summary: Sets the sorting configuration of the pivotgrid.
member.param: The lambda which configures the sorting

example.code: <%:Html.Kendo().PivotConfigurator() .Name("pivotconfigurator") .Sortable(sorting => sorting.AllowUnsort(true)) .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) %>

@(Html.Kendo().PivotConfigurator() .Name("pivotconfigurator") .Sortable(sorting => sorting.AllowUnsort(true)) .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) )

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramBuilder`2.Layout(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder{`0,`1}})
member.summary: The layout of a diagram consists in arranging the shapes (sometimes also the connections) in some fashion in order to achieve an aesthetically pleasing experience to the user. It aims at giving a more direct insight in the information contained within the diagram and its relational structure.On a technical level, layout consists of a multitude of algorithms and optimizations:and various ad-hoc calculations which depend on the type of layout. The criteria on which an algorithm is based vary but the common denominator is:Kendo diagram includes three of the most used layout algorithms which should cover most of your layout needs - tree layout, force-directed layout and layered layout. Please, check the type property for more details regarding each type.The generic way to apply a layout is by calling the layout() method on the diagram. The method has a single parameter options. It is an object, which can contain parameters which are specific to the layout as well as parameters customizing the global grid layout. Parameters which apply to other layout algorithms can be included but are overlooked if not applicable to the chose layout type. This means that you can define a set of parameters which cover all possible layout types and simply pass it in the method whatever the layout define in the first parameter.
member.param: The action that configures the layout.

member.summary: Defines the pannable options.
member.param: Enables or disables the pannable option.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileListViewItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileListViewItemFactory})
member.summary: Builds nested MobileListView items.
member.param: Action for declaratively building MobileListView items.
member.code:
<% Html.Kendo().MobileListViewView()
                       .Name("View")
                       .Items(items => 
                       {
                            items.Add().Text("Master Item")
                                .Items(masterItem => 
                                {
                                    masterItem.Add().Text("Inner Item 1");
                                    masterItem.Add().Text("Inner Item 2");
                                });
                        })
                       .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PivotGridBuilder`1.Sortable
member.summary: Enables grid column sorting.

example.code: <%:Html.Kendo().PivotGrid() .Name("pivotgrid") .Sortable() .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) %>

@(Html.Kendo().PivotGrid() .Name("pivotgrid") .Sortable() .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) )

member.summary: Sets the sorting configuration of the pivotgrid.
member.param: The lambda which configures the sorting

example.code: <%:Html.Kendo().PivotGrid() .Name("pivotgrid") .Sortable(sorting => sorting.AllowUnsort(true)) .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) %>

example.code: @(Html.Kendo().PivotGrid() .Name("pivotgrid") .KPITrendTemplate("#: dataItem.value #") .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource.Xmla() .Columns(columns => columns.Add("[Date].[Calendar]").Expand(true)) .Rows(rows => rows.Add("[Geography].[City]")) .Measures(measures => measures.Values(new string[]{"[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]"})) .Transport(transport => transport .Connection(connection => connection .Catalog("Adventure Works DW 2008R2") .Cube("Adventure Works")) .Read(read => read .Url("http://demos.telerik.com/olap/msmdpump.dll") .DataType("text") .ContentType("text/xml") .Type(HttpVerbs.Post) ) ) ) )

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.SchedulerBuilder`1.EventTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template used to render the scheduler events.
member.param: The eventTemplate.

example.code:
@(Html.Kendo().Scheduler() .Name("scheduler") .Date(new DateTime(2013, 6, 13)) .StartTime(new DateTime(2013, 6, 13, 10, 00, 00)) .EndTime(new DateTime(2013, 6, 13, 23, 00, 00)) .Height(600) .EventTemplate( "
" + "" + "

" + "#: kendo.toString(Start, 'hh:mm') # - #: kendo.toString(End, 'hh:mm') #" + "

" + "

#: title #

" + "Movie in IMDB" + "
") .Views(views => { views.DayView(); views.AgendaView(); }) .BindTo(Model) )

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.SchedulerBuilder`1.Timezone(System.String)
member.summary: The timezone which the scheduler will use to display the scheduler appointment dates. By default the current system timezone is used. This is an acceptable default when the scheduler widget is bound to local array of events. It is advisable to specify a timezone if the scheduler is bound to a remote service. That way all users would see the same dates and times no matter their configured system timezone. The complete list of the supported timezones is available in the List of IANA time zones Wikipedia page.
member.param: The timezone

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().StockChart(Model)
                       .Name("Chart")
                       .Navigator(nav => nav
                            .Series(series =>
                            {
                               series.Bar(s => s.SalesAmount);
                            })
                            .Hint(hint => hint
                                .Template("From: #= from # To: #= to #")
                            )
                       )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem,``0})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will be "flat" which means a TreeView item will be created for every item in the data source.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem}})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().TreeView() .Name("TreeView") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewEventBuilder.Collapse(System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Defines the inline handler of the collapse client-side event
member.param: The handler code wrapped in a text tag (Razor syntax).

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().TreeView()
                      .Name("TreeView")
                      .Events(events => events.Collapse(
                           @<text>
                           function(e) {
                               // event handling code
                           }
                           </text>
                      ))
                      .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemFactory})
member.summary: Configures the child items of a .
member.param: The add action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().TreeView()
                        .Name("TreeView")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemBuilder.Id(System.String)

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemBuilder.Expanded(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define when the item will be expanded on intial render.
member.param: If true the item will be expanded.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().TreeView()
                        .Name("TreeView")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            })
                            .Expanded(true);
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemBuilder.Checked(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify whether the item should be initially checked.
member.param: If true, the item will be checked.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewItemBuilder.HasChildren(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the expand mode of the treeview item.
member.param: If true then item will be loaded on demand from client side, if the treeview DataSource is properly configured.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().TreeView()
                        .Name("TreeView")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            })
                            .HasChildren(true);
                        })
            %>

<% }) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.RowAction(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.GridRow{`0}})
member.summary: Sets a lambda which is executed for every table row rendered server-side by the grid.
member.param: The lambda which will be executed for every table row

example.code:
<%@Page Inherits="System.Web.Mvc.ViewPage<IEnumerable>" %>
            <%: Html.Kendo().Grid(Model)
                .Name("grid")
                .RowAction(row =>
                {
                    // "DataItem" is the Product instance to which the current row is bound
                    if (row.DataItem.UnitsInStock > 10)
                    {
                        //Set the background of the entire row
                        row.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
                    }
                });
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.CellAction(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.GridCell{`0}})
member.summary: Sets a lambda which is executed for every table cell rendered server-side by the grid.
member.param: The lambda which will be executed for every table cell

example.code:
<%@Page Inherits="System.Web.Mvc.ViewPage<IEnumerable>" %>
            <%: Html.Kendo().Grid(Model)
                .Name("grid")
                .CellAction(cell =>
                {
                   if (cell.Column.Name == "UnitsInStock")
                   {
                       if (cell.DataItem.UnitsInStock > 10)
                       {
                           //Set the background of this cell only
                           cell.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
                       }
                   }
                })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.EnableCustomBinding(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true the grid will perform custom binding.
member.param: If true enables custom binding.

example.code: <%:Html.Kendo().Grid<Product>() .Name("grid") .EnableCustomBinding(true) .DataSource(dataSource => // configure the data source dataSource .Ajax() .Read(read => read.Action("Products_Read", "Home")) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.Columns(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridColumnFactory{`0}})
member.summary: Sets the column configuration of the grid.
member.param: The lambda which configures columns

example.code:
<%:Html.Kendo().Grid<Product>()
                .Name("grid")
                .Columns(columns =>
                {
                    columns.Bound(product => product.ProductName).Title("Product Name");
                    columns.Command(command => command.Destroy());
                })
                .DataSource(dataSource =>
                    // configure the data source
                    dataSource
                        .Ajax()
                        .Destroy(destroy => destroy.Action("Products_Destroy", "Home"))
                        .Read(read => read.Action("Products_Read", "Home"))
                )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.Events(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridEventBuilder})
member.summary: Sets the event configuration of the grid.
member.param: The lambda which configures the events

example.code:
<%:Html.Kendo().Grid<Product>()
                 .Name("grid")
                 .DataSource(dataSource =>
                     // configure the data source
                     dataSource
                         .Ajax()
                         .Read(read => read.Action("Products_Read", "Home"))
                 )
                 .Events(events => events.DataBound("grid_dataBound"))
             %>
             <script>
             function grid_dataBound(e) {
                 // handle the dataBound event
             }
             </script>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MenuBuilder.BindTo``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.MenuItem,``0})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will be "flat" which means a menu item will be created for every item in the data source.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MenuBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.MenuItem}})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Menu() .Name("Menu") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to MenuItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to MenuItem properties ) ) %>

member.param: The add action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Menu()
                        .Name("Menu")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItem}})
member.summary: Binds the panelbar to a list of objects. The panelbar will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar() .Name("PanelBar") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to PanelBarItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to PanelBarItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemFactory})
member.summary: Configures the child items of a .
member.param: The add action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar()
                        .Name("PanelBar")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemBuilder.Expanded(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define when the item will be expanded on intial render.
member.param: If true the item will be expanded.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar()
                        .Name("PanelBar")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            })
                            .Expanded(true);
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileButtonBuilder.ClickOn(System.String)
member.summary: Configures the DOM event used to trigger the button click event/navigate in the mobile application. Can be set to "down" as an alias for touchstart, mousedown, MSPointerDown, and PointerDown vendor specific events. Setting the clickOn to down usually makes sense for buttons in the header or in non-scrollable views for increased responsiveness.By default, buttons trigger click/navigate when the user taps the button (a press + release action sequence occurs).
member.param: The value that configures the clickon.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileButtonGroupBuilder.SelectOn(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the DOM event used to select the button. Accepts "up" as an alias for touchend, mouseup and MSPointerUp vendor specific events.By default, buttons are selected immediately after the user presses the button (on touchstart or mousedown or MSPointerDown, depending on the mobile device). However, if the widget is placed in a scrollable view, the user may accidentally press the button when scrolling. In such cases, it is recommended to set this option to "up".
member.param: The value that configures the selecton.

member.summary: Applicable to remote views only. If set to true, the remote view contents will be reloaded from the server (using Ajax) each time the view is navigated to.
member.param: The value that configures the reload.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileViewBuilder.Scroller(System.Object)
member.summary: Configuration options to be passed to the scroller instance instantiated by the view. For more details, check the scroller configuration options.
member.param: The value that configures the scroller.

member.summary: If set to true, the view will stretch its child contents to occupy the entire view, while disabling kinetic scrolling. Useful if the view contains an image or a map.
member.param: The value that configures the stretch.

member.summary: The text to display in the NavBar title (if present) and the browser title.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileViewBuilder.UseNativeScrolling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, the view will use the native scrolling available in the current platform. This should help with form issues on some platforms (namely Android and WP8). Native scrolling is only enabled on platforms that support it: iOS > 5+, Android > 3+, WP8. BlackBerry devices do support it, but the native scroller is flaky.
member.param: The value that configures the usenativescrolling.

member.summary: If set to true, the user can zoom in/out the contents of the view using the pinch/zoom gesture.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileScrollViewBuilder.AutoBind(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false the widget will not bind to the DataSource during initialization. In this case data binding will occur when the change event of the data source is fired. By default the widget will bind to the DataSource specified in the configuration.Applicable only in data bound mode.
member.param: The value that configures the autobind.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileScrollViewBuilder.Duration(System.Int32)
member.summary: The milliseconds that take the ScrollView to snap to the current page after released.
member.param: The value that configures the duration.

member.summary: The template which is used to render the pages without content. By default the ScrollView renders a blank page.Applicable only in data bound mode.
member.param: The value that configures the emptytemplateid.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileScrollViewBuilder.EnablePager(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true the ScrollView will display a pager. By default pager is enabled.
member.param: The value that configures the enablepager.

member.summary: Determines how many data items will be passed to the page template.Applicable only in data bound mode.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileScrollViewBuilder.PageSize(System.Double)
member.summary: Multiplier applied to the snap amount of the ScrollView. By default, the widget scrolls to the next screen when swipe. If the pageSize property is set to 0.5, the ScrollView will scroll by half of the widget width.

member.summary: Introduced in the 2014 Q1 Service Pack 1 release. If set to true, the navigation will parse and prefix the url fragment value with !, which should be SEO friendly.
member.param: The value that configures the hashbang.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.HideAddressBar(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to hide the browser address bar. Supported only in iPhone and iPod. Doesn't affect standalone mode as there the address bar is always hidden.
member.param: The value that configures the hideaddressbar.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Initial(System.String)
member.summary: The id of the initial mobile View to display.
member.param: The value that configures the initial.

member.summary: The id of the default Application layout.
member.param: The value that configures the layout.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Loading(System.String)
member.summary: The text displayed in the loading popup. Setting this value to false will disable the loading popup.Note: The text should be wrapped inside <h1> tag.
member.param: The value that configures the loading.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.ModelScope(System.Object)
member.summary: The view model scope. By default, the views will try to resolve their models from the global scope (window).
member.param: The value that configures the modelscope.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Platform(System.String)
member.summary: Which platform look to force on the application. Supported values are "ios" (meaning iOS 6 look), "ios7","android", "blackberry" and "wp". You can also set platform variants with it ("android-light" or "android-dark"), but keep in mind that it will still override the platform. If this is not desired, use the skin option.
member.param: The value that configures the platform.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Root(System.String)
member.summary: Applicable if pushState is used and the application is deployed to a path different than /. If the application start page is hosted on http://foo.com/myapp/, the root option should be set to /myapp/.
member.param: The value that configures the root.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Retina(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, the application will set the meta viewport tag scale value according to the device pixel ratio, and re-scale the app by setting root element font size to the respective value. This will result in the widget borders/separators being real 1px wide. For example, in iPhone 4/5, the device pixel ratio is 2, which means that the scale will be set to 0.5, while the app root will receive a font-size: 2 * 0.92 inline style set.
member.param: The value that configures the retina.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.ServerNavigation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, the application will not use AJAX to load remote views.
member.param: The value that configures the servernavigation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Skin(System.String)
member.summary: The skin to apply to the application. Currently, Kendo UI Mobile ships with nova, flat, material-light and material-dark skins in addition to the native looking ones. You can also set platform variants with it ("android-light" or "android-dark").Note: The Material themes were renamed to material-light and material-dark in 2014 Q3 SP1. With 2014 Q3 (v2014.3.1119) and older Kendo UI versions, material and materialblack skin names should be used.
member.param: The value that configures the skin.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.StatusBarStyle(System.String)
member.summary: Set the status bar style meta tag in iOS used to control the styling of the status bar in a pinned to the Home Screen app. Available as of Q2 2013 SP.
member.param: The value that configures the statusbarstyle.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.Transition(System.String)
member.summary: The default View transition. For a list of supported transitions, check the Getting Started help topic.
member.param: The value that configures the transition.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.UpdateDocumentTitle(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to update the document title.
member.param: The value that configures the updatedocumenttitle.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.UseNativeScrolling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, the mobile application uses flexbox for the mobile views layout. The content element is made scrollable, either by initializing a mobile scroller or with the browser supported overflow: auto and -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch CSS declarations. When the useNativeScrolling configuration option is set to true, the view header and footer are positioned using position: fixed CSS declaration. The view content vertical padding is adjusted to match the header and footer height; The default browser scroller is utilized for the content scrolling.For more information regarding native scrolling check this article.
member.param: The value that configures the usenativescrolling.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MobileApplicationBuilder.WebAppCapable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables the default behavior of Kendo UI Mobile apps to be web app capable (open in a chromeless browser). Introduced in Q2 2013.
member.param: The value that configures the webappcapable.

member.name: T:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2
member.summary: Defines the fluent API for configuring the DiagramLayoutSettings settings.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.EndRadialAngle(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines where the circle/arc ends. The positive direction is clockwise and the angle is in degrees. This setting is specific to the radial tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the endradialangle.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.Grid(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutGridSettingsBuilder{`0,`1}})
member.summary: Each layout algorithm has a different set of parameters customizing the layout but they also all have a common collection of parameters which relate to the way 'pieces' of a diagram are organized. A diagram can have in general disconnected pieces, known as components, which can be organized in a way independent of the way a component on its own is arranged. In the picture above, this is one diagram consisting of four components.When you apply a certain layout an analysis will first split the diagram in components, arrange each component individually and thereafter organize the components in a grid. The common parameters referred above deal with this grid layout, they define the width, margin and padding of the (invisible) grid used to organize the components.
member.param: The action that configures the grid.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.HorizontalSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: Either the distance between the siblings if the tree is up/down or between levels if the tree is left/right. In tipOver tree layout this setting is used only for the direct children of the root
member.param: The value that configures the horizontalseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.Iterations(System.Double)
member.summary: The number of times that all the forces in the diagram are being calculated and balanced. The default is set at 300, which should be enough for diagrams up to a hundred nodes. By increasing this parameter you increase the correctness of the simulation but it does not always lead to a more stable topology. In some situations a diagram simply does not have a stable minimum energy state and oscillates (globally or locally) between the minima. In such a situation increasing the iterations will not result in a better topology.In situations where there is enough symmetry in the diagram the increased number of iterations does lead to a better layout. In the example below the 100 iterations was not enough to bring the grid to a stable state while 300 iterations did bring all the nodes in such a position that the (virtual) energy of the diagram is a minimum.This setting is specific to the force-directed layout
member.param: The value that configures the iterations.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.LayerSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: The height (in a vertical layout) or width (in a horizontal layout) between the layers.
member.param: The value that configures the layerseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.NodeDistance(System.Double)
member.summary: In the force-directed layout this setting defines the optimal length between 2 nodes, which directly correlates to the state of the link between them. If a link is longer than there will be a force pulling the nodes together, if the link is shorter the force will push the nodes apart. The optimal length is more and indication in the algorithm than a guarantee that all nodes will be at this distance. The result of the layout is really a combination of the incidence structure of the diagram, the initial topology (positions of the nodes) and the number of iterations.In the layered layout it defines the minimum distance between nodes on the same level. Due to the nature of the algorithm this distance will only be respected if the the whole crossing of links and optimimzation does not induce a shift of the siblings.This setting is specific to the force-directed layout and layered layout
member.param: The value that configures the nodedistance.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.RadialFirstLevelSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: Controls the distance between the root and the immediate children of the root. This setting is specific to the radial tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the radialfirstlevelseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.RadialSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the radial separation between the levels (except the first one which is defined by the aforementioned radialFirstLevelSeparation). This setting is specific to the radial tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the radialseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.StartRadialAngle(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines where the circle/arc starts. The positive direction is clockwise and the angle is in degrees. This setting is specific to the radial tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the startradialangle.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.UnderneathHorizontalOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the horizontal offset from a child with respect to its parent. This setting is specific to the tipOver tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the underneathhorizontaloffset.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.UnderneathVerticalSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the vertical separation between siblings and sub-branches. This setting is specific to the tipOver tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the underneathverticalseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.UnderneathVerticalTopOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the vertical separation between a parent and its first child. This offsets the whole set of children with respect to its parent. This setting is specific to the tipOver tree layout.
member.param: The value that configures the underneathverticaltopoffset.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.VerticalSeparation(System.Double)
member.summary: Either the distance between levels if the tree is up/down or between siblings if the tree is left/right. This property is not used in tipOver tree layout but rather replaced with three additional ones - underneathVerticalTopOffset, underneathVerticalSeparation and underneathHorizontalOffset
member.param: The value that configures the verticalseparation.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.DiagramLayoutSettingsBuilder`2.Type(Kendo.Mvc.UI.DiagramLayoutType)
member.summary: The layout type.
member.param: The value that configures the type.

member.summary: The layout subtype.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttBuilder`2.Toolbar(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttToolbarFactory})
member.summary: If a String value is assigned to the toolbar configuration option, it will be treated as a single string template for the whole Gantt Toolbar, and the string value will be passed as an argument to a kendo.template() function.If a Function value is assigned (it may be a kendo.template() function call or a generic function reference), then the return value of the function will be used to render the Gantt Toolbar contents.If an Array value is assigned, it will be treated as the list of commands displayed in the Gantt Toolbar. Commands can be custom or built-in ("append", "pdf").The "append" command adds a new task to the gantt.The "pdf" command exports the gantt in PDF format.
member.param: The action that configures the toolbar.

member.param: The action that configures the tooltip.

member.summary: The views displayed by the Gantt and their configuration. The array items can be either objects specifying the view configuration or strings representing the view types (assuming default configuration). By default the Kendo UI Gantt widget displays "day", "week", and "month" views.
member.param: The action that configures the views.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ContextMenuBuilder.BindTo``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.ContextMenuItem,``0})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will be "flat" which means a menu item will be created for every item in the data source.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ContextMenuBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.ContextMenuItem}})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The data source.
The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().ContextMenu() .Name("ContextMenu") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to ContextMenuItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to ContextMenuItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ContextMenuItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ContextMenuItemFactory})
member.summary: Configures the child items of a .
member.param: The add action.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().ContextMenu()
                        .Name("ContextMenu")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })
            %>

member.summary: The configuration of the treelist columns. An array of JavaScript objects or strings. JavaScript objects are interpreted as column configurations. Strings are interpreted as the field to which the column is bound. The treelist will create a column for every item of the array.
member.param: The action that configures the columns.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeListBuilder`1.Resizable(System.Boolean)

member.param: The value that configures the reorderable.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeListBuilder`1.ColumnMenu
member.summary: If set to true the treelist will display the column menu when the user clicks the chevron icon in the column headers. The column menu allows the user to show and hide columns, filter and sort (if filtering and sorting are enabled). By default the column menu is not enabled.Can be set to a JavaScript object which represents the column menu configuration.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeListBuilder`1.Toolbar(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeListToolbarFactory{`0}})
member.summary: If a String value is assigned to the toolbar configuration option, it will be treated as a single string template for the whole treelist Toolbar, and the string value will be passed as an argument to a kendo.template() function.If a Function value is assigned (it may be a kendo.template() function call or a generic function reference), then the return value of the function will be used to render the treelist Toolbar contents.If an Array value is assigned, it will be treated as the list of commands displayed in the treelist Toolbar. Commands can be custom or built-in ("create", "excel", "pdf").
member.param: The action that configures the toolbar.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttPdfSettingsBuilder.PaperSize(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the paper size of the PDF document. The default "auto" means paper size is determined by content.Supported values:
member.param: The value that configures the papersize.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttPdfSettingsBuilder.ProxyURL(System.String)
member.summary: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally. Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:The proxy should return the decoded file with set "Content-Disposition" header.
member.param: The value that configures the proxyurl.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttPdfSettingsBuilder.ProxyTarget(System.String)
member.summary: A name or keyword indicating where to display the document returned from the proxy.If you want to display the document in a new window or iframe, the proxy should set the "Content-Disposition" header to inline; filename="<fileName.pdf>".
member.param: The value that configures the proxytarget.

member.summary: Sets the subject of the PDF file.
member.param: The value that configures the subject.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GanttPdfSettingsBuilder.Title(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the title of the PDF file.
member.param: The value that configures the title.

member.summary: The data source which contains assignment data items. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing kendo.data.DataSource instance.If the dataSource option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new kendo.data.DataSource instance using that value as data source configuration.If the dataSource option is an existing kendo.data.DataSource instance the widget will use that instance and will not initialize a new one.
member.param: The value that configures the datasource.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.SpreadsheetSheetFilterSettingsColumnCriteriaBuilder.Operator(Kendo.Mvc.UI.SpreadsheetFilterOperator)
member.summary: The criterion operator type.Supported types vary based on the inferred column data type (inferred): * Text * contains - the text contains the value * doesnotcontain - text does not contain the value * startswith - text starts with the value * endswith - text ends with the value * Date * eq - date is the same as the value * neq - date is not the same as the value * lt - date is before the value * gt - date is after the value * Number * eq - is equal to the value * neq - is not equal to the value * gte - is greater than or equal to the value * gt - is greater than the value * lte - is less than or equal to the value * lt - is less than the value
member.param: The value that configures the operator.

member.summary: The value for the criteria operator.
member.param: The value that configures the value.

member.summary: The value for the criteria operator.
member.param: The value that configures the value.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.SpreadsheetExcelSettingsBuilder.ProxyURL(System.String)
member.summary: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally. Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:The proxy should return the decoded file with the "Content-Disposition" header set to attachment; filename="<fileName.xslx>".
member.param: The value that configures the proxyurl.
